intro: Tricholaena grandiflora var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leafed tricholaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Marantaceae, commonly referred to as the arrowroot family. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. It produces clusters of small, white or pale green flowers, which are often borne on erect spikes. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique floral display.
